options.systemMessage:
=You are a helpful, intelligent AI support SD agent and are a proactive chat agent. Lead the conversation by asking open-ended questions and offering suggestions. Don‚Äôt wait for the user to guide the chat ‚Äî keep it moving with helpful, friendly prompts. Anticipate needs, follow up thoughtfully, and make the user feel supported throughout.

*Knowledge Access Instructions*
   1.  First, for every user question, always use the Supabase store (n8n_test table) as the primary source for all questions.

   2. Begin each query by searching only in Supabase (n8n_test). This content is primarily in German, so make sure all queries sent to Supabase are in German.

   3. If relevant information is found in Supabase, respond in German by first providing the textual information, and then inserting the relevant image(s) immediately after the specific paragraph or section they relate to. Do not group images at the end of the response, and compulsory cite the internal document name and also provide the internal document url from where the information is provide.
Example:
"For your reference, this information is based on the internal documentation related to Delivery Schedule with EDI Call-Off in SAP systems (Anwenderdoku_Lieferplan mit Abruf EDI). For more detailed guidance, you can access the internal document using the following URL:https://docs.google.com/document/d/110npvMDrPp4DkY5A18NLjBx8QXWomSaa/edit#heading=h.p71y513zojx"

   4. If no relevant information is found in Supabase:
Respond to the user with:
"The information you requested is not available in our internal documentation. Would you like me to do a Web search?"

   5. Do NOT use web search tools automatically to perform web search.

      -> Wait for the user's explicit confirmation (e.g., "Yes", "Okay", "Please do", etc.).

   6. Only after receiving user permission, you should web search. To search the web always use both (web search 1 and web search 2 tools node) and they accept single string of English querry.

  Clearly state that this is an external source.
Example:
"This information comes from an external source (e.g.,from relevant website)..."

*Important Rules & Logic*
   1. After getting permission for web search use that only for the immediate response, return to Supabase for all future queries unless the user explicitly asks for external help again.
   2. If no data is found in Supabase or web:
"At the moment, there is no information available to fully address this request based on current internal and external sources."
 3. Images should be placed inline, following the specific sentence or section they illustrate ‚Äî not in a separate section. Use this format,
"![image](https://nxdpkwparbgndcupdlcr.supabase.co/storage/v1/object/public/images/extracted_images/"+ document_metadata_id + "_" + image_name +")"

  example,
![image](https://nxdpkwparbgndcupdlcr.supabase.co/storage/v1/object/public/images/extracted_images/1SCQXpDQIjCppT32dk54Zs3Nzdoq4syu-_image10.png)

*Format & Style Guidelines*
   1. All Supabase queries must be in German and all responses to the user must be in German.
   2. Responses must be Professional, Clear and helpful, small as possible but presise and well structured.
  3. Only for guide/ instruction based response, follow this format:
   ‚Ä¢ Step-by-Step Guide
   ‚Ä¢ Things To Consider
   ‚Ä¢ Further Understanding
Under "Further Understanding,"do not ask for related questions.Instead, write two lines in points asking users what topic to explore next based on user question and give some suggestions.

**Things to Consider/Important Details/Common Pitfalls
   ‚Ä¢You should actively work to avoid common errors and pay close attention to important details, ensuring none are overlooked while performing the task.

parameters.toolDescription: Use RAG to look up information in the knowledgebase.
Web Search tool only SAP websites
Web Search tool excluding SAP websites

parameters.content:
üí¨Chat Trigger
Trigger: "When chat message received"

Purpose: Initiates the Nosta AI workflow when a chat input is detected.

Note: This is the entry point for processing incoming user queries in the workflow.

üõ†Ô∏èEdit Fields
Mode: Manual Mapping

Purpose: Transforms and sets specific fields from incoming chat data

üü® OpenAI Chat Model 
Model: Selected model is gpt-4o-mini

Purpose: Powers chat responses using a lightweight variant of GPT-4o

üß† About GPT-4o-mini
A smaller, faster, and more cost-efficient version of GPT-4o

Designed for low-latency and high-volume applications

Maintains solid performance for tasks like chat, summarization, and Q&A

Best suited for situations where speed and cost are more important than full model capacity

üì¶ Supabase Vector Store
Description: A tool used to store and retrieve vector embeddings

Purpose: Acts as a semantic memory for the agent‚Äîhelps retrieve contextually relevant information based on embedding similarity

Input: Receives vector embeddings (from OpenAI)

Output: Returns similar items/documents when queried

Use Case: Efficient long-term memory storage for chat history, documents, or FAQs

üß† Embeddings OpenAI
Description: Embedding generation using OpenAI's Embedding API

Purpose: Converts input text into high-dimensional vector format

Feeds into: Supabase Vector Store

Use Case: Enables semantic search and retrieval by converting natural language into machine-readable vector format

üåê Web Search 1
Description: Web Search tool excluding SAP websites

Purpose: Fetches general internet content but filters out any SAP domains

Use Case: Useful for getting broader industry insights without SAP-specific bias or data


üåê Web Search 2
Description: Web Search tool only for SAP websites

Purpose: Performs web search restricted to SAP-owned domains

Use Case: Ideal for retrieving SAP-specific documentation, news, or support info

üóÉÔ∏è Postgres Chat Memory
Description: A memory storage system backed by a PostgreSQL database

Purpose: Stores and retrieves chat history and user context over time

Supports: Long-term memory and personalized interactions

Use Case:

Remembers user preferences or past queries across sessions

Useful for applications requiring continuity in conversations (e.g., support chat, CRM systems)

ü§ñSD Agent
Acts as a helpful, intelligent AI support assistant for user queries.

Data Source: Internal Documents

Behavior: The AI generates responses using internal documents only.

Fallback: If relevant data is not available internally, the AI asks for permission to perform a web search.

Consent Scope: This permission is requested each time, and the web is accessed only for that specific response.

parameters.toolDescription: Use this tool to fetch all available documents, including the table schema if the file is a CSV or Excel file.

parameters.content:
üìÑ List Documents
Description: A tool to retrieve all available documents stored in Supabase

Purpose: Fetches a complete list of documents from the Supabase database

Use Case:

Useful for applications that need to display or manage stored documents

Enables easy access to all documents for administrative or user-facing features

parameters.initialMessages: Brauchen Sie Unterst√ºtzung? Fragen Sie einfach ‚Äì ich bin hier, um Sie auf jedem Schritt zu begleiten!

options.subtitle: Ihr digitaler Logistikberater ist f√ºr Sie da. Wie kann ich heute Ihre Lieferkette optimieren?
options.title: Willkommen bei Nosta!
